variables.description: Apolipoprotein E (APOE) e4 allele: is the strongest risk factor for Late Onset Alzheimer Disease (LOAD). At least one copy of APOE-e4
variables.label: APOE4

enumerations.value: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

variables.description: Race. 1=American Indian or Alaskan Native; 2=Asian; 3=Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander; 4=Black or African American; 5=White; 6=More than one race; 7=Unknown
variables.label: Participant Racial Category

variables.description: Ethnicity. 1=Hispanic or Latino; 2=Not Hispanic or Latino; 3=Unknown
variables.label: Participant Ethnicity

variables.description: Participant Gender. Gender: refers to the socially constructed characteristics of women and men.
variables.label: Participant Gender

variables.description: Participant Date of Birth. Age (Chronological age): refers to the calendar age. It is the number of years that have elapsed from birth to the exam date.
variables.label: Age Baseline

variables.description: Participant Date of Birth. Age (Chronological age): refers to the calendar age. It is the number of years that have elapsed from birth to the exam date.
variables.label: Age

variables.description: Participant Date of Birth. Age (Chronological age): refers to the calendar age. It is the number of years that have elapsed from birth to the exam date.
variables.label: Age
Diagnostic Status Baseline
variables.description: Diagnostic status based in clinical/cognitive evaluation (AD, MCI, NC). ADNI1 baseline diagnosis at VISCODE=="bl," 1=NL;2=MCI;3=AD

variables.label: CDRSB
variables.description:
Clinical Dementia Rating. CDR is derived from the scores in each of the six categories (box scores"): 1. Memory
2. Orientation 3. Judgment and Problem Solving 4. Community Affairs 5. Home and Hobbies 6. Personal Care (0, 0.55)

variables.label: FAQ
variables.description: FAQ Total Score (0-30). The FAQ measures activities of daily living. Sum of 10 subscores (0=Normal (0);1=Never did, but could do now (0);2=Never did, would have difficulty now (1);3=Has difficulty, but does by self (1);4=Requires assistance (2);5=Dependent (3)

variables.label: MoCA
variables.description: Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA). was designed as a rapid screening instrument for mild cognitive dysfunction. It assesses different cognitive domains: a ttention and concentration, executive functions, memory, language, visuoconstructional skills, conceptual thinking, calculations, and orientation. Time to administer the MoCA is approximately 10 minutes. The total possible score is 30 points; a score of 26 or above is considered normal. This test was not applied in ADNI-I.
RAVLT (forgetting). Test of episodic memory. Recall and recognize 15 words after a 30-minute delay interval.
variables.label: RAVLT forgetting

variables.description: RAVLT (learning). Test of episodic memory. Recall and recognize 15 words after a 30-minute delay interval.
variables.label: RAVLT learning

variables.description: RAVLT (percent forgetting). Test of episodic memory. Recall and recognize 15 words after a 30-minute delay interval.
variables.label: RAVLT percent forgetting

variables.description: RAVLT (immediate). Test of episodic memory. Recall 15 words immediately after an intervening interference list
variables.label: RAVLT immediate
MMSE
variables.description: MMSE Total score. Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE): is a global assessment of cognitive status (Folstein et al., 1975).The MMSE is a fully structured scale that consists of 30 points grouped into seven categories. A perfect score is 30 points; a score of 24 is the recommended, and most frequently used, cutpoint for dementia; a score of 23 or lower indicates dementia.

variables.label: ADAS11
variables.description: ADAS Total score-11 items. Classic 70 point total. Excludes Q4 (Delayed Word Recall) and Q14 (Number Cancellation).

variables.label: ADAS13
variables.description: ADAS Total score-13 items. 85 point total including Q4 (Delayed Word Recall) and Q14 (Number Cancellation). The ADAS is a brief cognitive test battery that assesses learning and memory, language production, language comprehension, constructional praxis, ideational praxis, and orientation.
Participant ECog - Mem. memory 8 items (memory1-memory8). Everyday Cognition-Participant Self Report (Only applied in ADNIGO, 2).
variables.label: EcogPtMem

variables.description: Average FDG-PET of angular, temporal, and posterior cingulate. Most important hypometabolic regions that are indicative of pathological metabolic change in MCI and AD.
variables.label: FDG

variables.description: Average PIB SUVR of frontal cortex, anterior cingulate, precuneus cortex, and parietal cortex.
variables.label: PIB

variables.description: Protocol under which data was collected (ADNI1, GO or 2)
variables.label: Collection Protocol

variables.description: Date of the exam (EXAMDATE). You can extract EXAMDATE from the registry table (REGISTRY.csv) using RID, Phase, and VISCODE.
variables.label: Exam Date

variables.description: Visit code ( sc, scmri, bl, m03, m06, m12, m18, m24, etc) sc:screening visit, bl: baseline, m: month. See ADNI2 VISCODE2 Assignment.pdf in ADNI website
variables.label: Visit Code

variables.description: Roster ID (RID) which you see in every ADNI CSV file.
variables.label: Roster ID

variables.description: ADNI subject IDs of the form 123_S_5678 ( the last 4 digits correspond to the roster ID (RID) which you see in every CSV file)
variables.label: Subject ID (PTID)

variables.description: Visit code ( sc, scmri, bl, m03, m06, m12, m18, m24, etc) sc:screening visit, bl: baseline, m: month. See ADNI2 VISCODE2 Assignment.pdf in ADNI website
variables.label: Visit Code

variables.description: Months from baseline (to nearest 6 months, as continuous, based on VISCODE)
variables.label: Months from baseline (based on VISCODE)

variables.description: Months from baseline (to nearest 6 months, based on EXAMDATEs)
variables.label: Months from baseline (based on EXAMDATE)
